container.description: Contains widgets that act as containers, windows, dialogs
container.name: container

jet.description:
Based on YUI3's namespace

This module allows to load different modules asynchronously and to reuse them when they were already loaded. Its basic use looks like:
jet.author: Juan Ignacio Dopazo
jet.name: jet

base.description: The Base module provides base classes for Utilities and Widgets.
base.name: base

cookie.description: Provides abstracion for easier use of cookies
cookie.name: cookie

dragdrop.description: Provides functionality for dragging and dropping elements
dragdrop.name: dragdrop

datatable.description: Provides a DataTable widget that can be sorted and linked to a DataSource
datatable.name: datatable

datasource.description: DataSources are different ways of accessing data and parsing it into an schema
datasource.name: datasource

constructors.description: A collection of DOM Nodes

getDocument.description: Returns a new NodeList with all the documents of all the nodes in the collection that are Iframes

height.description: Gets/sets the height of all the nodes in the collection

toggle.description: If a node in the collection is hidden, it shows it. If it is visible, it hides it.

ready.description: Executes a callback when the DOM to which the first node in the collection belongs is ready

find.description: Finds all the nodes below the ones in the current collection that match the search query

append.description: Appends nodes to the ones in the current node list

previous.description: Returns a new NodeList with all the previous siblings of the nodes in the collection

insertBefore.description: Inserts all nodes in the current node list before the target node

next.description: Returns a new NodeList with all the next siblings of the nodes in the collection

setClass.description: Sets the class name of all nodes in the collection

width.description: Gets/sets the width of all the nodes in the collection

html.description: Gets or sets the innerHTML of all the nodes in the node list

toggleClass.description: Adds/removes a certain class from all nodes in the collection

addClass.description:
Adds a number of classes to all nodes in the collection
Takes multiple string parameters

params.name: configuration
params.description: key/value pairs, as in the Attribute class

Graphic.description:
Basic Graphic class
A graphic represents a figure, an SVG element or its VML counterpart

parent.description: Returns a new NodeList with all the parents of the current nodes

params.name: deep
params.description: If true, all nodes in the brach are cloned. If not, only the ones in the collection

clone.description: Returns a new NodeList with all nodes cloned from the current one

removeClass.description:
Removes a number of classes from all nodes in the collection.
Takes multiple string parameters

unbind.description: Removes an event listener from all the nodes

link.description:
Returns a new NodeList containing all the nodes in the current list and the ones in the new one
Useful for applying properties to a bigger group of nodes, while keeping the original references

offset.description:
Returns an object literal containing:
  • top: top position in px
  • left: left position in px
  • width: width in px
  • height: height in px

on.description: Adds an event listener to all the nods in the list

prependTo.description: Inserts all nodes in the current collection before the first child of the target node

unbindAll.description:
Removes all event listeners from all the current nodes
If "crawl" is true, it also removes them from all the nodes in the branches defined by the nodes

attr.description: Gets or sets tag attributes to the nodes in the collection

params.name: filter
params.description: Return only the children that match the tag or index in this parameter

children.description: Returns a new NodeList with all the children of the current nodes

appendTo.description: Appends all nodes in the current collection to the target node

remove.description:
Removes all the nodes from the DOM tree.
Unless keepEvents is true, it alse removes all event listeners from the nodes

currentStyle.description: Returns the computed style of the first node in the collection

each.description:
Iterates through the NodeList The callback is passed a reference to the node and an iteration index. The "this" keyword also refers to the node. ie:
$("div").each(function (node, i) {
    if (i % 2 == 1) {
        $(node).addClass("even");
    } else {
        $(node).addClass("odd");
    }
});

hasClass.description: Returns true if the first node in the collection has the className CSS class

first.description: Returns a new NodeList with all the first children of the nodes in the collection

Overlay.name: Overlay

params.name: config
params.description: Object literal specifying widget configuration properties

constructors.description: An Overlay is a Module that floats in the page (doesn't have position static)

center.description: If true, the overlay is positioned in the center of the page

height.description:
The height of the overlay.
If set to 0 (zero) the height changes with the content

draggable.description: If true, the overlay can be dragged

fixed.description: If true, the overlay is position is set to fixed

Overlay.description: An Overlay is a Module that floats in the page (doesn't have position static)

SimpleDialog.name: SimpleDialog

params.name: config
params.description: Object literal specifying widget configuration properties

constructors.description: A SimpleDialog is a Panel with simple form options and a button row instead of the footer

buttons.description: An array of configuration objects for the Button class

SimpleDialog.description: A SimpleDialog is a Panel with simple form options and a button row instead of the footer

DataSource.name: DataSource

params.name: config
params.description: Object literal specifying widget configuration properties

constructors.description: Base class for all data sources. The DataSource class shouldn't be used directly

onBeforeParse.description: Adds an event listener to the "beforeParse" event

DataSource.description: Base class for all data sources. The DataSource class shouldn't be used directly

DataSource.Local.name: DataSource.Local

params.name: config
params.description: Object literal specifying widget configuration properties

constructors.description: A Local DataSource uses local variables

DataSource.Local.description: A Local DataSource uses local variables

utils.Mouse.name: utils.Mouse

params.name: config
params.description: Object literal specifying widget configuration properties

constructors.description:
A utility for tracking the mouse movement without crashing the browser rendering engine.
Also allows for moving the mouse over iframes and other pesky elements

move.description:
Fires not when the mouse moves, but in an interval defined by the frequency attribute
This way you can track the mouse position without breakin the browser's rendering engine
because the native mousemove event fires too quickly

up.description: Fires when the mouse button is released

down.description:
Start tracking. Equivalent to setting the tracking attribute to true.
Simulates the mousedown event

up.description:
Stop tracking. Equivalent to setting the tracking attribute to false
Simulates the mouseup event

frequency.description: Frequency at which the tracker updates

tracking.description: Tracking status. Set it to true to start tracking

utils.Mouse.description:
A utility for tracking the mouse movement without crashing the browser rendering engine.
Also allows for moving the mouse over iframes and other pesky elements

$.description:
The global object is a finder method that finds HTML elements.
The query string allows for different simple searches: "#foo" (get elemnet by id), ".foo" (gets elements by class), "foo" (get elements by tag) or an array of html elements
For more complex queries, take a look at the Sizzle module

params.name: r
params.description: the object to modify

params.name: s
params.description: the object to inherit

params.name: [px]
params.description: prototype properties to add/override

params.name: [sx]
params.description: static properties to add/override

extend.description:
From the guys at YUI (Thanks! This function is GENIUS!)
Utility to set up the prototype, constructor and superclass properties to
support an inheritance strategy that can chain constructors and methods.
Static members will not be inherited.

walkTheDOM.description: Walks through the DOM tree starting in th branch that derives from node

mix.description:
Copies all properties from B to A.
Doesn't overwrite properties unless the overwrite parameter is TRUE

params.name: key/value
params.description: pairs of class/function names and definitions

add.description: Adds properties to the $ object (shortcut for adding classes)

parseQuery.description:
Does all the work behind the $() function
You shouldn't overwrite it unless you know what you're doing

win.description: A pointer to the last Windo that was referenced by the $() function

context.description: A pointer to the last Document that was referenced by the $() function.

Widget.name: Widget

params.name: config
params.description: Object literal specifying widget configuration properties

constructors.description:
Base class for all widgets. 
Provides show, hide, render and destroy methods, the rendering process logic
and basic attributes shared by all widgets

afterRender.description: Fires after the render process is finished

render.description: Render event. Preventing the default behavior will stop the rendering process

destroy.description: Preventing the default behavior will stop the destroy process
Destroys the widget by removing the elements from the dom and cleaning all event listeners

render.description:
Starts the rendering process. The rendering process is based on custom events. The widget class fires a "render" event to which all subclasses must subscribe. This way all listeners are fired in the order of the inheritance chain. ie: In the Overlay class, the render process is: render() method -> Module listener -> Overlay listener -> rest of the render() method (appends the boundingBox to the srcNode) This helps use an easy pattern of OOP CSS: each subclass adds a CSS class name to the boundingBox, for example resulting in
. That way a panel can inherit css properties from module and overlay.

className.description: The class name applied along with the prefix to the boundingBox

srcNode.description:
The node to which the widget will be appended to. May be set as a 
configuration attribute, with a setter or as the first parameter of the render() method

boundingBox.description: The bounding box contains all the parts of the widget

rendered.description: Rendered status. Shouldn't be changed by anything appart from the Widget.render() method

classPrefix.description: Prefix for all CSS clases. Useful for renaming the project

Widget.description:
Base class for all widgets. 
Provides show, hide, render and destroy methods, the rendering process logic
and basic attributes shared by all widgets

Hash.name: Hash

keys.description: Returns an array with all the keys of a hash

loadScript.description:
Dinamically inserts a script before the first script it finds on the page (at least the one executing this)
It loads scripts asynchronously, so it doesn't lock the browser and the loaded scripts can't use document.write()

values.description: Returns an array with all the valus of a hash

params.name: [thisp]
params.description: Sets the value of the this keyword

Hash.description:
Utilities for working with object literals
Throughout jet the Hash type means an object lieteral

jet.name: jet

params.name: config
params.description: Object literal with configuration options

constructors.description:
Global function. Returns an object with 2 methods: use() and add().

jet().use("node", function ($) { //do something with $ });

This snippet will load the Node module, and when it finishes loading it'll execute the function. Each module must call the jet().add() method to tell the loader it has finished loading:

jet().add("node", function ($) { $.method = function () {}; });

A variable is passed to every module and the function defined in the use() method. This variable acts as a main library and is shared by each module and the main function, but not between different calls to the "use" method. Ie:

jet().use("node", function ($) { $.testProperty = "test"; }); jet().use("node", function ($) { alert($.testProperty); //alerts "undefined" });

Since it is a parameter, it can have any name but it still acts the same way. Also, each module is called in the order defined by the "use" method. So:

jet().use("node", "anim", function (L) { // Here the L variable contains both Node and Anim // The Node module is called first on L and the Anim module after, // so it can overwrite anything Node did, extend classes, etc });

New modules can be defined by passing an object literal instead of a string to the "use" method with a "name" property and a "path" or "fullpath" property.

jet().use("node", {name:"myModule", fullpath:"http://localhost/myModule.js"}, function ($) { //do something });

If "path" is defined instead of "fullpath", the loader will append "path" to a predefined base URL. This base URL can be modified by passing the jet() function an object literal with a "base" property:

jet({ base: "http://www.mydomain.com/modules/" }).use("node", function ($) { //in this case the "core" module is loaded from http://www.mydomain.com/modules/node.min.js });

use.description:
Allows to load modules and obtain a unique reference to the library augmented by the requested modules 
This method works by overloading its parameters. It takes names (String) of predefined modules
or objects defining name and path/fullpath of a module. The last parameter must be a function 
that contains the main logic of the application.

add.description:
Adds a module to the loaded module list and calls update() to check if a queue is ready to fire
This method must be called from a module to register it

base.description: prefix for all script and css urls

modules.description: Allows to define your own modules. Currently the same as using object literals in the use() method

loadCss.description: If true, css modules are loaded

jet.description:
Global function. Returns an object with 2 methods: use() and add().

jet().use("node", function ($) { //do something with $ });

This snippet will load the Node module, and when it finishes loading it'll execute the function. Each module must call the jet().add() method to tell the loader it has finished loading:

jet().add("node", function ($) { $.method = function () {}; });

A variable is passed to every module and the function defined in the use() method. This variable acts as a main library and is shared by each module and the main function, but not between different calls to the "use" method. Ie:

jet().use("node", function ($) { $.testProperty = "test"; }); jet().use("node", function ($) { alert($.testProperty); //alerts "undefined" });

Since it is a parameter, it can have any name but it still acts the same way. Also, each module is called in the order defined by the "use" method. So:

jet().use("node", "anim", function (L) { // Here the L variable contains both Node and Anim // The Node module is called first on L and the Anim module after, // so it can overwrite anything Node did, extend classes, etc });

New modules can be defined by passing an object literal instead of a string to the "use" method with a "name" property and a "path" or "fullpath" property.

jet().use("node", {name:"myModule", fullpath:"http://localhost/myModule.js"}, function ($) { //do something });

If "path" is defined instead of "fullpath", the loader will append "path" to a predefined base URL. This base URL can be modified by passing the jet() function an object literal with a "base" property:

jet({ base: "http://www.mydomain.com/modules/" }).use("node", function ($) { //in this case the "core" module is loaded from http://www.mydomain.com/modules/node.min.js });

DataSource.Get.name: DataSource.Get

params.name: config
params.description: Object literal specifying widget configuration properties

constructors.description: A Get DataSource that uses JSON for getting data across domains

DataSource.Get.description: A Get DataSource that uses JSON for getting data across domains

scrollTop.description: Gets the scrolling height or makes the browser scroll

scrollLeft.description: Gets the scrolling width or makes the browser scroll

getWindowFromDocument.description: Returns the window object to which the current document belongs

screenSize.description: Returns the inner size of the screen

params.name: config
params.description: Object literal specifying widget configuration properties

constructors.description: Makes an element draggable

addHandler.description: Adds a handler to the handler list

cursor.description: the type of cursor that will be shown on hover

handlers.description: A list of elements that will start the dragging

params.name: config

Cookie.name: Cookie

params.name: optional
params.description: - duration of the variable in days

set.description: Sets the value of a cookie variable

isSet.description: Returns whether a cookir variable is set

get.description: Get the value of a cookie

Cookie.description: Provides abstracion for easier use of cookies

params.name: config
params.description: Object literal specifying widget configuration properties

constructors.description: DragDrop class

drop:miss.description: Fires when a draggable object is release but not over any target

drop:hit.description: Fires when a draggable object is drop into a target

Panel.name: Panel

params.name: config
params.description: Object literal specifying widget configuration properties

constructors.description:
A panel is an overlay that resembles an OS window without actually being one,
to the problems they have (stop javascript execution, etc)

underlay.description: The underlay is inserted after the contentBox to allow for a more complex design

shadow.description: If true, the panel shows a shadow

contentBox.description:
A panel uses another container inside the boundingBox 
in order to have a more complex design (ie: shadow)

close.description: If true, a close button is added to the panel that hides it when clicked

Panel.description:
A panel is an overlay that resembles an OS window without actually being one,
to the problems they have (stop javascript execution, etc)

Lang.name: Lang
Lang.description:
Provides utility methods for finding object types and other
methods that javascript provides in some browsers but not in others such as trim()

isArray.description: Returns if o is an array

params.name: the
params.description: string to trim

trim.description:
Returns a string without any leading or trailing whitespace.
Code by Steven Levithan
http://blog.stevenlevithan.com/archives/faster-trim-javascript

isRecordSet.description: Returns whether an object is a RecordSet

isString.description: Returns if o is a string

isBoolean.description: Returns if o is a boolean

isRecord.description: Returns if an object is a Record

isNative.description: Returns whether the function is a native function or not

clone.description: Clones an object, returning a copy with the sames properties

random.description: A more traditional random function. Returns a random integer between 0 and num-1

isHash.description: Returns if o is an object literal

isValue.description: Returns false if o is undefined, null, NaN or Infinity. In any other case, return true

isFunction.description: Returns if o is a function

isNumber.description: Returns if o is a number

type.description: Returns the type of the object

params.name: config
params.description: Object literal specifying widget configuration properties

constructors.description: An AJAX DataSource

params.name: data
params.description: If data is passed, it is converted into several Records

constructors.description: A collections of Records

getRecords.description: Returns all records in the set

getCount.description: Returns the number of records in the set

push.description: Adds data to the set, creating new Records

params.name: key
params.description: The data key that will be sorted

params.name: order
params.description: the order in which to sort. May be "asc" or "desc"

sortBy.description: Sorts the records based on a key of the data they hold

replace.description: Replaces all records with new data

Button.name: Button

params.name: config
params.description: Object literal specifying widget configuration properties

constructors.description: A button may be a push button, a radio button or other form elements that behave as buttons

focus.description: Fires the focus event and sets the button as active

Button.description: A button may be a push button, a radio button or other form elements that behave as buttons

EventCache.name: EventCache

clear.description: Removes all listeners from a node

add.description: Adds a listener to the cache

remove.description: Removes a method from the cache, but doesn't do anything to the node's listener

flush.description: Removes all listeners from all nodes recorded in the cache

EventCache.description: Keeps a record of all listeners attached to the DOM in order to remove them when necessary

EventTarget.name: EventTarget

constructors.description: A class designed to be inherited or augmented into other classes and provide custom events

params.name: eventType
params.description: Extra parameters will be passed to all event listeners

fire.description: Fires an event, executing all its listeners

unbindAll.description: Removes all event listeners of all types

EventTarget.description: A class designed to be inherited or augmented into other classes and provide custom events

Record.name: Record

params.name: An
params.description: object literal

constructors.description: A record is a Hash width a unique id

getData.description: Returns the data of the record. Must be an object literal

getId.description:
Returns the id of the record. Each record has a unique id globally.alert
This allows for easy filtering, ordering, etc of records.alert

get.description: Shortcut for getting a value from the record's data

Record.description: A record is a Hash width a unique id

DataTable.name: DataTable

params.name: config
params.description: Object literal specifying widget configuration properties

constructors.description: A DataTable is an HTML table that can be sorted and linked to a DataSource

onDataReturnReplaceRows.description: Replace all rows when the DataSource updates

onDataReturnAddRows.description: When the DataSource updates, treat the returned data as additions to the table's recordSet

getFirstTd.description: Returns the first cell element in a row

getNextTd.description: Returns the next cell element in a row based on the one passed as a parameter

getNextTr.description: Returns the next html row element base on the one passed as a parameter

getFirstTr.description: Returns the first html row element in the table

DataTable.description: A DataTable is an HTML table that can be sorted and linked to a DataSource

Attribute.name: Attribute

constructors.description: Provides get() and set() methods, along with getters, setters and options for configuration attributres

addAttr.description: Adds a configuration attribute, along with its options

getAttrs.description: Returns a key/value paired object with all attributes

params.name: config
params.description: - key/value pairs of attribute names and configs

isSet.description: Returns whether an attribute is set or not

Attribute.description: Provides get() and set() methods, along with getters, setters and options for configuration attributres

Get.name: Get

update.description: Checks the state of each queue. If a queue has finished loading it executes it

Get.description:
Loads scripts and CSS files.
Included with the jet() core

Module.name: Module

params.name: config
params.description: Object literal specifying widget configuration properties

constructors.description: A module is a basic container with header, body and footer

body.description:
The body of the module.
If set to a string a node is creating and the string is set to its innerHTML
A body is always present in a Module

header.description:
The header of the module.
If set to a string a node is creating and the string is set to its innerHTML

footer.description:
The footer of the module.
If set to a string a node is creating and the string is set to its innerHTML

Module.description: A module is a basic container with header, body and footer

OOP.name: OOP

augment.description: Augments a class with the functionality of another, without chaining prototypes

params.name: optional
params.description: - An object literal with methods to overwrite in the subclass' prototype

extend.description:
Allows for an inheritance strategy based on prototype chaining.
When exteiding a class with extend, you keep all prototypic methods from all superclasses

OOP.description:
Utilities for object oriented programming in JavaScript.
JET doesn't provide a classical OOP environment like Prototype with Class methods,
but instead it helps you take advantage of JavaScript's own prototypical OOP strategy

indexOf.description: Returns the index of the first occurence of needle

inArray.description: Returns whether needle is present in haystack

remove.description: Searchs an haystack and removes the needle if found

params.name: fn
params.description: callback

params.name: thisp
params.description: sets up the this keyword inside the callback

opera.description: true if the browser is Opera

ie.description: If the browser is Internet Explorer, this property is equal to the IE version. If not, it is false

mac.description: true if the operating system is Apple OSX

win.description: true if the operating system is Windows

webkit.description: true if the browser uses the Webkit rendering engine (ie: Safari, Chrome)

gecko.description: true if the browser is based on the Gecko rendering engine (ie: Firefox)

params.name: config
params.description: Object literal specifying widget configuration properties

constructors.description: Basic class for all utilities

destroy.description: Calls itself when the window unloads. Allows for easier memory cleanup
